Anaconda Documentation¶

This module is called Anaconda

Table¶

7th August - 2012

ATable is a class deticated to handeling the loading of tables and accces. If you’ll need to change the data a AMutableTable class is available.

Currently the Class support different kinds of CSV format but still not the ” ” notation.

class Anaconda.Table.CSVFormat¶

This class is used to format, and interpret CSV strings. It contains 2 options, the field delimiter and the line delimiter, that descripes where to split the lines, and fields, and how to join them.

readTable(content)¶

Reads a Table from a string using the field and line delimiter

setFieldDelimiter(delimiter)¶

Sets the field delimiter

setLineDelimiter(delimiter)¶

Sets the line delimiter

writeColoums(coloums)¶

Contatenates a array of fields to a row-string

writeRows(rows)¶

Contatenates a array of string representations of row

writeTable(table)¶

Writes a Table to a string using the field and line delimiter

class Anaconda.Table.ATable(header)¶

ATable is the main class of this module. It is desinged to be immutable, which means that the ATable only functions to read data from the Table. If you want to change the data in the table, use the AMutableTable wich is designed for that.

getFloatArray(columns, NaN='NA')¶

Get Selected columns in numpy ndarray. There is a posibility to set a NaN string value this is by default set to ‘NA’.
